text: ASTER UNDAY OF THE ESURRECTION OF THE ORD PRIL 4 2021 From all of us at St Josephs a joyous and blessed Easter to each of you To all those home from school welcome home To all those who are joining with us in prayer while visiting family welcome to St Josephs May the peace and joy of the risen Christ remain in our hearts not only for the fifty days of the Easter season but always This week we welcome Bishop Rhoades to St Joseph On Tuesday Bishop will confirm our nine Confirmandi who have been diligently preparing for this sacrament in our Religious Education Program May we keep our Confirmandi Cassie Luke Austin Anthony Emma Jacquelyn Grant Angela and Derek in our prayers as they receive this wonderful sacrament Through the gifts and fruits of the Holy Spirit may they be strengthened to preach the name of Jesus Christ to the world special Thank You to our many catechesis who have aided in their formation throughout the years special Thank You to all those who have assisted in our Lent Holy Week and Easter Liturgies Our Sacred Space Committee has ensured that the Church is well decorated and a source of beauty to our eyes Our pianists Dianne and Diane and our volunteer cantors have ensured that our liturgical music is a source of joy for our ears Our Master of Ceremonies Dan and our altar servers have prayerfully led us in each of our liturgies Our Paschal Candle was beautifully painted by Nancy Our RCIA Team Coordinators Jill and Tom have served as a tremendous help in our RCIA Program this year And the many hands helping behind the scenes with Michelle in our parish office and Nathan Corey and Rick have been a tremendous help to me in ensuring that we have been prepared for each part of our liturgical celebrations To all of you and the many others who have helped throughout these seasons Thank You As we celebrated the resurrection in this Year of St Joseph our Easter gift to you is Leonard DeLorenzos Model of Faith Reflecting on the Litany of St Joseph This book looks at different titles associated with our patron St Joseph As a parish we will also begin introducing the Litany of St Joseph into our weekly devotionals as we begin to recite this litany after our Wednesday evening Masses May we deepen our relationship with St Joseph as we learn more about him this Easter season Faithfully in the Risen Christ Fr David MASS
